data.enText: showing extreme courage and admired by many people

data.chText: 救援人员不畏艰险努力营救全体船员。
data.enText: Rescuers made heroic efforts to save the crew.

data.chText: 有必胜决心的；不畏艰难的
data.enText: showing great determination to succeed or to achieve sth, especially sth difficult

data.chText: 我们目睹了我队为赢回奖杯所作的不懈努力。
data.enText: We watched our team's heroic struggle to win back the cup.
that is about or involves a hero

data.chText: 英雄事迹 / 神话故事

data.enText: This was foolishness on a heroic scale .

tr: a verse form suited to the treatment of heroic or elevated themes
having or displaying qualities appropriate for heroes
example: the heroic attack on the beaches of Normandy

tr: especially of actions courageously undertaken in desperation as a last resort
example: made a last desperate attempt to reach the climber
the desperate gallantry of our naval task forces marked the turning point in the Pacific war"- G.C.Marshal
they took heroic measures to save his life

tr: of behavior that is impressive and ambitious in scale or scope
surpassing the ordinary (especially in size or scale)
relating to or characteristic of heroes of antiquity

value.def: If you describe a person or their actions as heroic, you admire them because they show extreme bravery.

example.ex: The heroic sergeant risked his life to rescue 29 fishermen from their blazing trawler...
example.tran: 英勇的中士冒着生命危险从熊熊燃烧着的拖网渔船上救出了29名渔民。

example.ex: His heroic deeds were celebrated in every corner of India.
example.tran: 他的英雄事迹在印度广为传颂。

example.ex: He had acted heroically during the liner's evacuation.
example.tran: 他在乘客撤离客轮的过程中表现得很英勇。

value.def: If you describe an action or event as heroic, you admire it because it involves great effort or determination to succeed.

example.ex: The company has made heroic efforts at cost reduction...
example.tran: 公司在降低成本方面付出了艰苦卓绝的努力。

example.ex: He finally faltered in the last game of a heroic match...
example.tran: 他在这场艰苦比赛的最后一局中踉跄结束。

example.ex: Their dogged single-mindedness is almost heroic.
example.tran: 他们不屈不挠专心致志的劲头简直是一种壮举。

value.tran: 矢志不渝的;艰苦卓绝的

example.ex: Single parents cope heroically in doing the job of two people.
example.tran: 单身父母扮演双亲的角色非常辛苦。

value.def: Heroic means being or relating to the hero of a story.
Heroics are actions involving bravery, courage, or determination.

example.ex: ...the man whose aerial heroics helped save the helicopter pilot...
example.tran: 以空中的英雄壮举拯救了直升机飞行员的人

example.ex: England need heroics from the captain now.
example.tran: 英格兰队此刻需要队长采取英勇果断的行为。

value.tran: 英雄壮举;英勇果断的行为

value.def: If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur.

example.ex: He said his advice was: 'No heroics, stay within the law'...
example.tran: 他说自己的建议是：“不要逞英雄，要遵纪守法。”

example.ex: Cut it out, Perry. You've performed your heroics. It's all over now.
example.tran: 住手吧，佩里。你已经逞过英雄了。现在一切都结束了。

trans: 英雄体偶句诗(相互押韵的含有五个抑扬格的二行诗)
